DataElement.preferredName: Patient Wound Complication Personal Medical History Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free text field to specify and describe the wound healing complication.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Wound Complication Personal Medical History
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures who has complications to wounds (healing complications) in their personal history.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity.:Complication; any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of (or because of) another disease.:an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: Damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity.
Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the free text field to specify an adverse event.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.

DataElement.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form
